review: I'm a bit reluctant to be writing a review after only a few hours...but so far I'm really loving the Fire TV!A few things to note:- I'm a huge Apple person, but opted for the Amazon Fire TV because they actually had a streaming box that has been updated in the last 4 years...unlike my Apple TV, which can't even load up images at this point, despite having the most updated software- I've moved all of my streaming content almost exclusively to Prime, since they have just about everything Netflix does (except the Netflix Original Series like "House of Cards" or "Orange is the New Black"....which I can watch in a couple of days with a quick re-subscribe to Netflix).- I also cut the (cable) cord, and love having the ability to buy shows like "Louis" ala cart on Amazon.  My cable bill is now around $80, down from $165+.  So paying $.99/episode of a current show is a steal, and it can be set up to automatically download the night it's released- I also have a Tivo Roamio which has Amazon Prime access, but the Fire TV's quick navigation not waiting for content to buffer is night and day from my Tivo boxI read a review that said this box was fast, but had no soul.  I will agree to some extent, but it was really easy to set up and I liked the simplicity of the interface, much much much more than the Apple TV interface.Other things I love:- X Ray:  super cool way to see the actors, music, etc when you press pause - just like the X Ray feature in the Kindle- Remote:  It's a nice soft, rubber feel that has a unique texture and is comfy in the hand.  A little on the light side....but again, so much better than the Apple remote- Apps:  You can subscribe to as few or as many apps as the Fire TV supports - like HBOGo or Netflix.  It's easy to sign up, and far less wonky to navigate on the Fire TV than other streaming devices I've usedI haven't ever used a Roku, but if you're at your wits end with your other streaming devices and are heavily invested in a Prime account - you should  seriously considering the Fire TV box.

review: While I find the UI clunky at times overall I am absolutely blown away with how snappy and feature packed the fire tv is. I had a Boxee and an Apple TV before this and this is just such a better value.I was hesitant to try the Roku 3 because of the clunky remote, strange UI and it being a "new" ecosystem for myself. Since I'm already established as an Amazon customer the fire tv was a much more seamless to integrate into my tech ecosystem.Very happy.
